sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Acushnet Holdings Corp. Reports Earnings Results for the Fourth Quarter Ended December 31, 2025
feed.summary: Acushnet Holdings Corp. announced its financial results for the fourth quarter and full year ended December 31, 2025. For Q4, the company reported increased sales of $477.22 million but a net loss of $34.9 million. Full-year sales reached $2,558.73 million, although net income for the year decreased to $188.55 million compared to the previous year.

feed.title: Global Net Lease Reports Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2025 Results
feed.summary: Global Net Lease, Inc. (GNL) announced its financial and operating results for the fourth quarter and full year 2025, exceeding its full-year AFFO guidance. The company reduced net debt by $2.2 billion, improved its credit rating to investment-grade, and repurchased 17.2 million shares. GNL's 2026 guidance focuses on reducing office exposure and redeploying capital into industrial and retail assets.

feed.title: Wynn hit with more class-action lawsuits after data breach
feed.summary: Wynn Resorts Ltd. is facing additional class-action lawsuits in U.S. District Court in Nevada following a cyberattack and data breach. The lawsuits allege the casino company failed to adequately protect customers' private information. A hacking group, ShinyHunters, had previously threatened to release stolen data, including personal details of Wynn employees, if a ransom was not paid.

feed.title: Eaton increases quarterly dividend to $1.10 per share
feed.summary: Eaton (NYSE:ETN) announced a 6% increase in its quarterly dividend to $1.10 per ordinary share, payable on March 27, 2026, to shareholders of record as of March 10, 2026. The intelligent power management company has consistently paid dividends since 1923 and reported revenues of $27.4 billion in 2025, operating in 180 countries. This dividend increase reflects the company's strong financial performance and commitment to shareholder returns.

feed.title: Sempra 2025 slides: $65B capital plan targets 11% rate base growth
feed.summary: Sempra (NYSE: SRE) has announced an ambitious five-year capital plan targeting $65 billion for 2026-2030, aiming for an 11% compound annual growth rate in its rate base, from $57 billion to $97 billion by 2030. This strategy includes divesting non-core assets like Ecogas and a 45% stake in Sempra Infrastructure Partners to fund utility infrastructure investments, predominantly in Texas operations. The company also provided strong earnings guidance through 2030, projecting a 7-9% long-term EPS growth rate and committing to annual common dividend increases.

feed.title: UpStart Collective Announces New Headquarters at US Bancorp Tower (“Big Pink”)
feed.summary: UpStart Collective, a Portland-based co-founder workspace and startup community, is relocating its headquarters to the US Bancorp Tower ("Big Pink") starting March 2, 2026. This move signifies its commitment to supporting early-stage founders and aligns with the building owner's vision to transform "Big Pink" into a central hub for Portland's startup scene. The new downtown location will be the sole operating site, facilitating events, educational programming, and partnerships within the innovation ecosystem.

feed.title: Here’s Why Verizon Stock Could Hit $70 After Closing Its $20 Billion Frontier Deal
feed.summary: Verizon's stock could reach $70 due to recent strategic moves including its $20 billion Frontier acquisition, a $25 billion share repurchase program, and an increased dividend. New CEO Dan Schulman’s aggressive subscriber-growth strategy, focusing on fiber-plus-wireless bundles and targeting significant postpaid phone net adds, positions Verizon for accelerated earnings growth and a re-rating by the market from a dividend stalwart to a convergence growth story. A valuation model suggests the stock is modestly undervalued at its current price and could yield a 39% total return over 4.8 years.

feed.title: Japan’s New Investment Horizon – Bloomberg Wall Street Week
feed.summary: Japan is undergoing a significant economic transformation driven by structural reforms, regulatory modernization, and a renewed focus on corporate governance, moving past three "lost decades" of stagnation. Inflation is forcing a shift of trillions in sidelined cash into productive investments, and private credit is emerging as a crucial third engine for financing long-term growth alongside traditional bank debt and equity. This evolution is reshaping Japan's corporate landscape, attracting global investors, and impacting strategic decisions for major companies like Sony and Panasonic Automotive.

feed.title: Sempra to sell Mexican natgas unit, delays LNG project
feed.summary: US energy firm Sempra announced it will sell its Mexican natural gas distribution unit, Ecogas México, for approximately US$500 million and has delayed the start of operations for its Energía Costa Azul LNG plant in Baja California from spring to summer 2026. This LNG project postponement is one year past its initial 2025 deadline. Simultaneously, Sempra is divesting 45% of its Sempra Infrastructure subsidiary to a KKR-led consortium for US$10 billion to focus on lower-risk utility operations in the US.

feed.title: Marathon Petroleum Corp SEC 10-K Report
feed.summary: Marathon Petroleum Corp has released its 2025 10-K report, detailing a decrease in total revenues but an increase in net income compared to 2024. The report highlights strategic acquisitions, capital management, and a positive future outlook despite challenges like volatile refining margins and regulatory risks. The company remains focused on operational excellence, sustainability, and returning capital to shareholders.

feed.title: Silversea Unveils Interiors for The Cormorant at 55 South
feed.summary: Silversea Cruises has revealed the interiors of its new 150-room hotel, The Cormorant at 55 South, located in Puerto Williams, Chile, set to open in October 2026. This hotel will be an integral part of Silversea's Antarctica Fly/Cruise program, providing a luxurious base for guests before and after their voyages. The design emphasizes relaxation, Chilean culture, and panoramic views, with various amenities including a fireplace lounge, a restaurant named Latitude 55, Bar Sur, and a boutique called Uncharted.

feed.title: More than 125 Georgetown County employees to lose their jobs, SC report says
feed.summary: International Paper Company will lay off 126 employees in Georgetown County as it proceeds with the permanent closure of its plant. This comes after an initial layoff of nearly 700 employees in 2024. The WARN report indicates these latest layoffs will occur between May 1 and the end of 2026, marking the complete shutdown of the remaining operations.

feed.title: Green Brick (GRBK) Earnings Call Transcript
feed.summary: Green Brick Partners (GRBK) reported Q4 2025 net income of $78 million, down 24.5% year-over-year, with diluted EPS at $1.78. Despite record home deliveries and net orders, gross margins declined due to increased incentives and a shift in product mix. The company emphasized its strong liquidity and balance sheet, with plans to expand its Green Brick Mortgage operations and continue strategic land investments, while also authorizing a $150 million share repurchase.

feed.title: GRAY MEDIA, INC SEC 10-K Report
feed.summary: Gray Media, Inc. (formerly Gray Television, Inc.) has released its 2025 10-K report, detailing a revenue decrease to $3,095 million and a net loss of $(85) million, primarily due to reduced political advertising. The company, a leading owner of local television stations, is pursuing strategic growth, debt management, and technological upgrades despite challenges from a competitive environment and regulatory oversight.

feed.title: United Rentals Is Up 6%. Here’s Where the Stock Could Go in 2026
feed.summary: United Rentals (URI) stock is up 6% year-to-date due to strong Q4 results, optimistic 2026 guidance, and expanded shareholder return plans. The company's valuation model suggests a target price of $1,027, indicating a 20% upside from its current trading level of around $854 per share. This positive outlook is driven by sustained demand from infrastructure, nonresidential construction, manufacturing reshoring, and data center expansion, particularly emphasizing specialty rentals and large project execution.

feed.title: eBay layoffs today: 6% of jobs cut days after buying Depop from Etsy
feed.summary: eBay is laying off approximately 800 employees, or 6% of its full-time workforce, to align with "strategic priorities" and reinvest in the business, despite heavily investing in AI previously. This marks the third round of layoffs since 2023 and comes shortly after the company acquired the second-hand clothing app Depop from Etsy for $1.2 billion, aiming to attract younger consumers. The announcement follows strong fourth-quarter earnings for 2025, where eBay exceeded revenue and EPS estimates.

feed.title: FedEx Sues For Refund After Supreme Court Ruling on Tariffs
feed.summary: FedEx has filed a lawsuit against the U.S. government demanding a full refund of tariffs it paid after they were unilaterally imposed last year by former President Donald Trump. This action follows a Supreme Court ruling that deemed the tariffs illegal. FedEx anticipates a significant financial impact from these tariffs, which it estimated at $1 billion to fiscal-year earnings in September.

feed.title: BMO Capital Markets Has Lowered Expectations for CoStar Group (NASDAQ:CSGP) Stock Price
feed.summary: BMO Capital Markets recently lowered its price target for CoStar Group (NASDAQ:CSGP) from $72 to $53, maintaining a "market perform" rating, while other analysts also trimmed targets following the company's Q4 earnings release. Despite beating Q4 estimates with strong revenue growth, CoStar issued soft Q1 2026 guidance, leading to near-term analyst downgrades, though the stock retains a "Moderate Buy" consensus. The company also announced a $1.5 billion share buyback program.

feed.title: Altria Declares $1.06 Quarterly Dividend
feed.summary: Altria Group, Inc. has announced that its Board of Directors declared a regular quarterly dividend of $1.06 per share. The dividend is payable on April 30 to shareholders of record as of March 25, with the ex-dividend date also being March 25.

feed.title: Hormel Foods reports 2026 Q1 results
feed.summary: Hormel Foods Corp. announced its first-quarter fiscal 2026 results, ending January 25, 2026, reporting net sales of $3.03 billion and adjusted diluted earnings per share of $0.34. The company saw strong growth in its Foodservice and International segments, while the Retail segment experienced a 19% drop in profit due to lower sales and higher costs. Hormel Foods reaffirmed its full-year fiscal 2026 net sales guidance and updated its operating income and diluted EPS guidance, reflecting adjustments for portfolio-shaping initiatives including recent business sales.

feed.title: Reasons Why You Should Hold ADP Stock in Your Portfolio for Now
feed.summary: Automatic Data Processing (ADP) is recommended for holding in investors' portfolios due to strong demand for its cloud-based Human Capital Management (HCM) solutions and Professional Employer Organization Services. The company is benefiting from recent acquisitions and transformative innovations, which are expected to drive significant earnings and revenue growth in fiscal years 2026 and 2027. Despite rising expenditures from growth initiatives, ADP maintains a solid liquidity position and strategic focus on expanding its HCM offerings.

feed.title: Sprouts, Tractor Supply Co. proposed in north Morgan Hill
feed.summary: The City of Morgan Hill is processing two retail development proposals for a Sprouts Farmers Market and a Tractor Supply Company store. The Tractor Supply Co. store, planned for Evergreen Village Shopping Center, was approved in November 2025 with construction expected to start this year. The Sprouts Farmers Market is eyed for a new shopping center called Poppy Ranch at Cochrane Road and De Paul Drive, targeting a Fall 2027 opening.

feed.title: Sempra quarterly and annual earnings fall, but beat estimates and stock rises
feed.summary: Sempra reported declines in its quarterly and annual earnings for 2025 but still managed to beat analysts' estimates. Despite the fall in earnings, with the company earning $1.80 billion in 2025 compared to $2.82 billion in 2024, its stock rose by 2.2% in early trading. The energy company also announced plans to significantly increase capital spending to $65 billion over the period 2026 to 2030.

feed.title: Gildan Activewear (NYSE:GIL) Releases Earnings Results, Beats Expectations By $0.02 EPS
feed.summary: Gildan Activewear (NYSE:GIL) announced strong Q4 earnings, surpassing analyst expectations with $0.96 EPS on $1.08 billion in revenue, reflecting a 31.1% increase year-over-year. Despite beating Q4 estimates and raising synergy targets following the HanesBrands acquisition, the company's updated FY 2026 guidance for EPS led to a 4.6% stock decline as it fell below street expectations. Analysts, however, maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating with an $80.00 consensus price target for the textile maker.

feed.title: Walmart to pay $100 million to settle allegations over deceptive practices for delivery drivers
authors: The Associated Press and AZFamily Digital News Staff
feed.summary: Walmart Inc. has agreed to pay $100 million to settle allegations from the U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC) concerning deceptive practices regarding its Spark delivery program. The FTC, along with 10 states, alleged that Walmart misled gig drivers about their pay and tips, falsely claiming all customer tips would go directly to drivers and failing to disclose tip splitting when deliveries were handled by multiple drivers. As part of the settlement, Walmart must implement an earnings verification program to ensure transparency and proper payment for its drivers.

feed.title: Decoding Realty Income's Options Activity: What's the Big Picture?
feed.summary: Investors have shown significant bullish options activity towards Realty Income (NYSE: O), with 8 uncommon trades spotted by Benzinga's options scanner. These trades suggest a projected price target range of $60.0 to $75.0 for Realty Income over the next three months. Three analysts have provided an average price target of $67.33, with ratings ranging from In-Line to Outperform.

feed.title: KKR's Corel to Separate Into Two Companies
feed.summary: KKR's Corel is set to separate into two distinct companies. The article also provides a brief overview of Unity Software's fourth-quarter financial results, reporting a 35% year-over-year revenue increase to $609 million, although the company posted a quarterly loss of 66 cents per share. Full details, particularly regarding Corel's separation, require a login or account creation.

feed.title: International Paper CEO pulls back the curtain on planned geographic split
feed.summary: International Paper plans to split into two geographically focused companies (North America and Europe) to "liberate" its regional powerhouses. CEO Andy Silvernail noted that the company "overestimated" customers' desire for global deals, as packaging supplier choices are often made locally. This move is part of the company's strategy to eliminate excess capacity, reduce costs, and aggressively invest in North American productivity.

feed.title: P/E Ratio Insights for Waste Management
feed.summary: Shares of Waste Management Inc. (NYSE: WM) are currently trading at $231.12, having increased by 1.32% in the current session and 3.58% over the past month, despite a 0.72% decrease over the past year. The company's P/E ratio of 34.04 is lower than the industry aggregate of 87.1 for Commercial Services & Supplies, which could suggest that the stock is undervalued or that shareholders do not anticipate significant future growth. It is crucial to consider other financial metrics and qualitative factors in conjunction with the P/E ratio for informed investment decisions, as the P/E ratio alone has limitations.

feed.title: Altria Declares Regular Quarterly Dividend of $1.06 Per Share
feed.summary: Altria Group, Inc. (NYSE: MO) announced that its Board of Directors declared a regular quarterly dividend of $1.06 per share. This dividend is payable on April 30, 2026, to shareholders of record as of March 25, 2026, with an ex-dividend date also on March 25, 2026. This announcement provides key financial details for investors regarding Altria's dividend distribution.

feed.title: Altria $1.06 dividend set for April 30 for March 25 holders
feed.summary: Altria Group, Inc. (NYSE: MO) announced a regular quarterly dividend of $1.06 per share. This dividend is payable on April 30, 2026, to shareholders of record as of March 25, 2026. The ex-dividend date is also March 25, 2026.

feed.title: Exxon Mobil's Guyana Triumph Becomes Global Sales Pitch
feed.summary: Exxon Mobil is leveraging its successful and rapid development of offshore oil and gas projects in Guyana as a global sales pitch to secure new deals. The company highlights its efficiency in ramping up production to nearly 1 million barrels a day in six years, presenting this as a "unique value proposition" to other resource-rich nations. While the oil boom has transformed Guyana's economy, concerns remain about inflation, inequality, and the need for local workforce development, which Exxon is addressing through a $100 million STEM education investment.

feed.title: Valero Energy sued over refinery explosion that left 1 man dead, 4 injured
feed.summary: Valero Energy is facing five lawsuits following a February 9 explosion and fire at its Ardmore, Oklahoma refinery, which resulted in one death and four injuries. The family of Jesse Biscamp filed a wrongful death suit, while three injured workers filed separate suits in San Antonio, all seeking more than $1 million in damages. Attorney Tony Buzbee, representing one of the injured, cited a 2012 Valero refinery incident as a precedent for seeking substantial compensation and deterrence.

feed.title: GPRK: Operational discipline and strategic acquisitions drive growth and resilience amid lower oil prices
feed.summary: In 2025, Geopark Ltd (GPRK) demonstrated strong operational discipline and portfolio transformation, surpassing production and financial targets despite lower oil prices. Strategic acquisitions in Argentina and Colombia have positioned the company for significant future growth, with ongoing cost control and hedging strategies bolstering its resilience. This summary is based on the company's Q4 2025 audio transcript.

feed.title: VFX studio Global Mofy rides iQIYI crime hit with 1.6M reservations
feed.summary: Global Mofy AI's visual effects unit, Mofy VFX, provided VFX production for the iQIYI Mist Theatre crime drama "The Devil Between Us". The 16-episode series, which premiered on February 23, 2026, achieved an in-platform popularity score over 7,705 and secured approximately 1.59 million pre-release reservations, ranking highly across various iQIYI charts. This project highlights Global Mofy's capability in delivering high-quality visual effects for premium content, reinforcing its AI-native production strategy.

feed.title: Global Mofy AI Limited's Mofy VFX Supports Visual Effects for iQIYI's Crime Drama Series The Devil Between Us
feed.summary: Global Mofy AI Limited's visual effects brand, Mofy VFX, provided VFX production services for iQIYI's crime drama series "The Devil Between Us," which premiered on February 23, 2026. The series achieved significant popularity, with over 1.59 million pre-release reservations and a high in-platform popularity score, underscoring Mofy VFX's capability in delivering high-quality visual effects for demanding productions. This success highlights the company's expertise in digital content production and strengthens its reputation in the industry.

feed.title: LSU, AT&T partner on $45 million Tiger Stadium network upgrade
feed.summary: LSU and AT&T are partnering on a $45 million network upgrade for Tiger Stadium, aiming to improve wireless coverage for over 100,000 fans, students, and first responders. The investment involves AT&T acquiring and overhauling the stadium's distributed antenna system (DAS) before the 2026 football season. This upgrade will enhance connectivity, expand Band 14 spectrum for FirstNet public safety communications, and follows a similar $81 million investment in other Louisiana venues.

feed.title: Bank of America or Wells Fargo: Which Big Bank Offers More Upside?
feed.summary: This article compares Bank of America (BAC) and Wells Fargo (WFC), two major U.S. banks, to determine which offers a more compelling investment opportunity. It analyzes their strategic positioning, growth outlooks, financial performance, valuation, and dividend yields. Ultimately, Bank of America is presented as the stronger investment due to its projected earnings growth, diversified revenue streams, attractive valuation, and operational momentum.

feed.title: Viatris Q4 EPS Tops, Brands Drive Revenue Growth, Stock Up
feed.summary: Viatris (VTRS) reported strong fourth-quarter 2025 results, with adjusted EPS of 57 cents and total revenues of $3.7 billion, both surpassing consensus estimates. The company's sales were driven by its Brands segment, particularly in Greater China and Emerging Markets, and the stock saw an increase in pre-market trading. Viatris also provided its 2026 guidance and reported several FDA approvals and submissions.

feed.title: What Teledyne Technologies (TDY)'s Lepton XDS Dual-Spectrum Camera Launch Means For Shareholders
feed.summary: Teledyne Technologies (TDY) recently launched the Lepton XDS, an advanced dual thermal-and-visible camera module designed for various OEM applications. This innovation reinforces Teledyne's focus on high-end imaging and sensing in defense, industrial, and space markets, integrating into its long-term growth narrative despite near-term pressures on cash flow and margins. Shareholders should consider this product's impact on Teledyne's strategic positioning and its relevance within the defense, unmanned, and space sectors.

feed.title: PFIZER INC SEC 10-K Report
feed.summary: Pfizer Inc. has released its 2025 Form 10-K report, detailing a 2% decrease in total revenues to $62.6 billion, primarily due to operational declines, with reported diluted EPS at $1.36 and adjusted diluted EPS up by 4% to $3.22. The report highlights strategic initiatives focused on R&D, market leadership, and cost realignment, while addressing significant challenges including pricing pressures, competition, patent expirations, and geopolitical risks. Pfizer aims to maximize key transactions, achieve R&D milestones, and invest in post-2028 growth, along with committing to net-zero emissions by 2040.

feed.title: Flavor Flav, MGM Resorts set party for Olympians
feed.summary: Rapper Flavor Flav and MGM Resorts International are partnering to host a "She Got Game" event for U.S. Winter Olympic athletes in Las Vegas from July 16-19. The event targets all U.S. female medal-winners, the U.S. bobsled and skeleton team from the Milan Games, and Paralympic athletes. This collaboration comes after Flavor Flav's initial offer to host female medalists received widespread support from Las Vegas resorts and officials.

feed.title: Lowe’s Companies Inc (NYSE:LOW) Profit Falls
feed.summary: Lowe's Companies Inc (NYSE:LOW) saw its profit fall in the fourth quarter of fiscal 2025, with net earnings of $1.0 billion and diluted EPS of $1.78, down from the previous year. Despite beating analyst estimates for adjusted EPS and revenue in Q4, the company issued a conservative outlook for 2026, anticipating total sales between $92 billion and $94 billion and adjusted EPS of $12.25 to $12.75, which is below analyst expectations due to a pressured housing market.

feed.title: Serving Patients Through Winter Storm Fern
feed.summary: McKesson successfully maintained the flow of critical medical products to patients during Winter Storm Fern, which caused widespread disruptions across the U.S. The company leveraged early-risk monitoring, proactive planning, and strong execution to anticipate disruptions and ensure safe operations. This event highlighted the importance of their coordinated recovery efforts and sustained investment in supply chain resilience.

feed.title: Intuitive Surgical or Abbott: Which MedTech Stock Is a Better Bet Now?
feed.summary: This article compares Intuitive Surgical (ISRG) and Abbott Laboratories (ABT), two MedTech companies, evaluating which is a better investment. Intuitive Surgical, rated as a "Strong Buy" by Zacks, focuses on procedure-driven growth through its da Vinci robotic systems, emphasizing innovation and recurring revenue. Abbott, a "Hold," offers diversified growth across devices, diagnostics, nutrition, and pharmaceuticals, providing defensive stability but with slower growth projections compared to Intuitive Surgical.

feed.title: Jefferies Sees Credit Karma Driving Potential Upside for Intuit Inc. (INTU)
feed.summary: Jefferies has reiterated a Buy rating on Intuit Inc. (INTU) while lowering its price target to $650, anticipating strong fiscal Q2 results despite a short tax e-filing period and seeing potential upside from Credit Karma. Intuit also recently launched the TurboTax "Done-For-You" experience, a hybrid model combining Agentic AI with expert support to streamline tax preparation. Although Intuit is considered a strong investment, some AI stocks may offer greater upside potential with less risk.

feed.title: Flutter Entertainment (NYSE:FLUT) Price Target Cut to $210.00 by Analysts at Oppenheimer
feed.summary: Oppenheimer has lowered its price target for Flutter Entertainment (NYSE:FLUT) from $280.00 to $210.00, while maintaining an "outperform" rating, indicating a potential 74% upside. Several other analysts have also revised their targets downwards, though the overall consensus remains a "Moderate Buy" with an average target of $265.60. Shares are currently trading around $120.65, near their 1-year low, reflecting recent market weakness and valuation concerns.

feed.title: Delta Air Lines Aims at Fleet Growth: More Upside Ahead?
feed.summary: Delta Air Lines is expanding its widebody fleet with new Airbus and Boeing aircraft to meet increasing air-travel demand and strengthen its global network. The fleet modernization efforts, including partnerships with GE Aerospace, aim to boost premium seating, improve fuel efficiency, and support international expansion into key long-haul destinations. While Delta's shares have outperformed its industry, its valuation is higher than industrial levels, and analysts have recently increased earnings estimates for 2026 and 2027.

feed.title: Gartner: How Agentic AI is Reshaping Supply Chain Roles
feed.summary: New research from Gartner indicates that agentic AI is significantly altering entry-level supply chain roles and talent strategies. While many leaders anticipate a reduction in entry-level positions and overall workforce headcount due to AI, high-performing organizations are focusing on talent reinvention, upskilling employees to work with AI, and optimizing workforce planning rather than solely cutting jobs. The report emphasizes redesigning roles and processes so that humans and AI can collaborate effectively to create value.

feed.title: Jefferies & Co Adjusts Agilent Technologies Price Target to $135 From $150, Maintains Hold Rating
feed.summary: Jefferies & Co has reduced its price target for Agilent Technologies (A) to $135 from $150, while reiterating a "Hold" rating on the stock. This adjustment reflects a moderated outlook for the company. Other firms like TD Cowen, Wells Fargo, Barclays, Baird, and UBS also adjusted their price targets for Agilent, mostly maintaining positive ratings but with lowered expectations.
